article.Body:
The government’s strategic disinvestment plans are in place already and the first such disinvestment can happen in the first quarter of next fiscal, said Arvind Panagariya, Vice-Chairman of NITI Aayog. Fiscal deficit at 3.2 percent by the Finance Minister is a great idea.

In the aviation sector, one such strategic disinvestment could be Pawan Hans, said Jayant Sinha, Minister of State for Civil Aviation. 

Speaking to CNBC-TV18, Sinha said the ministry is planning to expand airport capacity massively over next 10-15 years. There are plans to monetise land of the Airport Authority of India (AAI) for expansion purposes, Sinha said.

The ministry is also rooting an increase in public private partnership in tier-II cities to bring in more private players and moving aggressively on bids for Greenfield Airport.

On Air India, Sinha said improvement is happening in terms of governance and operating profit.
